Identification.LongTitle: An Act to establish an indemnification program for travelling exhibitions

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Canada Travelling Exhibitions Indemnification Act.
The definitions in this section apply in this Act.

Definition.Text: institution means a museum, art gallery, archives or library that

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: operates for educational or cultural purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: operates solely for the benefit of the public; and

Definition.Text: Minister means such member of the Queen’s Privy Council for Canada as may be designated by the Governor in Council as the Minister for the purposes of this Act.
travelling exhibition means an exhibition that meets at least one of the following criteria:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the total fair market value of the objects in the exhibition that are borrowed from outside Canada exceeds the total fair market value of those borrowed from inside Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the exhibition is shown in at least two provinces.

Subsection.Text: On application by an institution situated in Canada that organizes or hosts a travelling exhibition, the Minister may, subject to and in accordance with the regulations, enter into agreements with the respective owners of objects that are to be in the exhibition, and with the respective owners of appurtenances that are integral to the display of objects in the exhibition, under which Her Majesty agrees to indemnify those owners totally or partially for damage to or loss of the objects or appurtenances during

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the period of the loan of the object or appurtenance, if the exhibition is organized by an institution situated in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the period of the loan of the exhibition, if the exhibition is organized by an institution situated outside Canada.

Subsection.Text: Agreements referred to in subsection (1) may not provide for indemnification in respect of any period during which the exhibition is shown outside Canada.
Her Majesty’s liability under agreements referred to in subsection (1) may not exceed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $600,000,000, or any other amount that is provided by an appropriation Act or other Act of Parliament, in respect of each travelling exhibition; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $3,000,000,000, or any other amount that is provided by an appropriation Act or other Act of Parliament, at any given time in respect of all travelling exhibitions.

Section.Text: The Minister may engage experts to advise the Minister on any matter relating to the implementation of this Act and may, subject to any applicable Treasury Board requirements, policies or guidelines, fix their remuneration and expenses.
The Governor in Council may make regulations for carrying out the purposes and provisions of this Act and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, may make regulations respecting

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the minimum total fair market value of all the objects and appurtenances in a travelling exhibition in order for an institution to be eligible to apply under subsection 3(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the assessment criteria for applications under subsection 3(1), including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the standards of security, transportation, environmental control and handling with respect to indemnified objects and appurtenances,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the educational and professional quality of the exhibition,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the significance and relevance to Canadians of the exhibition’s theme and contents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the extent of public access to the exhibition;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the scope of coverage of agreements referred to in subsection 3(1), including limitations, exclusions, deductibles and maximum time periods;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the process and requirements governing applications under subsection 3(1);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the process for assessing or verifying the fair market value of each indemnified object and appurtenance;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the process for submitting and settling claims; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the conditions governing the payment of claims, and the manner of payment of claims.

Section.MarginalNote: Review of Act by parliamentary committee

Subsection.Text: The administration of this Act shall, five years after the coming into force of this Act, be reviewed by the parliamentary committee that may be designated or established by Parliament for that purpose.

The committee designated or established by Parliament for the purpose of subsection (1) shall undertake a review of the provisions and operation of this Act and shall, within a year after the review is undertaken or within any further time that may be authorized, submit a report to Parliament thereon including a statement of any changes to this Act or its administration that the committee would recommend.

Section.Text: This Act comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Act in force December 15, 1999, see SI/99-137.]
